div.p: This course is designed to improve your English language skills in order to study academic subjects at Adam Smith College or at university. It combines General English with the study of English for Academic Purposes. The course also prepares students for the International English Language Testing System examination (IELTS) and/or SQA Higher ESOL (Scottish university entrance level).
Type of Qualification:

ul.li: The Role of Information Technology in Business

div.p: For the first time, TV is becoming something the viewer can control and use for information and communication on demand, using existing methods of delivery and also emerging mobile technologies. Traditional and new media organisations are turning their attention to the new technologies and content designed to meet this demand. Many companies, such as the BBC, have built divisions dedicated to interactive television and are demanding new media professionals to lead them. This degree is designed to produce industry-ready graduates with first-hand experience in delivering interactive content, while equipping them with transferable skills and knowledge.
Practical Projects

A project focused integrated approach will be taken with all elements of the course in order that students maximise their learning experience within a relevant industrial context. As such, a commercial studio/station working atmosphere will be replicated as a focus of activity. Students will be producing interactive television programmes delivering real on-line content through ongoing practical projects. In addition to this they will produce a significant Personal Project in an area of their own choosing.

This course is of particular interest to those aspiring to careers in all areas of Digital Broadcasting and the Media industry including Television, Advertising, Interactive Design and Gaming, throughout the UK and abroad.

ul.li: HND Creative Industries: Television or equivalent HND

div.p: We are the only college in Scotland to offer this degree. It has been running for over eight years and is one of the most popular degrees at the College. You will have the chance to attend a summer school in August, which offers preparation for degree study. The degree offers an alternative assessment route, incorporating units from SVQ Level 4 Health and Social Care, if you do not intend to progress to postgraduate study.

ul.li: Supporting people with learning difficulties and their families

div.p: One of the following:

ul.li: HND in Supporting and Managing Special Learning Needs or equivalent HND
An advanced SVQ (Level 4) while in employment
Postgraduate professional courses such as Social Work, Teaching and Careers

course.title: BA Visual Communication and Digital Publishing

div.p: Graphic designers are at the forefront of a new communication revolution. In contemporary design there is a synthesis of old and new processes and an exploration of their potential without concern about respecting or erecting boundaries. In effect, the Graphic Design industry has become a digital democracy where more and more decisions are made through the accessibility of technology. The potential for creative input is vast and this course focuses on the development of this experimental new medium.

ul.li: Sound and Vision for Visual Communication

div.p: Practical Projects

A project focused integrated approach will be taken with all elements of the course in order that students maximise the learning experience with relevant industry practice. As such a commercial design studio atmosphere following commercial practice will be replicated as a focus of activity.

Students will be working on a mixture of live briefs, competition briefs and personal projects which combine to produce a programme of delivery which blends industry standards with high end creativity.
One of the following:

ul.li: HND in Visual Communication, Graphic Design or Equivalent
Industrial experience or other qualifications will be considered on an individual basis

course.dc:subject: Authorship/Photography/Publishing/Media

div.p: Industry analysts are currently predicting a shortfall of trained networking staff with a Business knowledge. Building on from our HND this course is designed to equip students with the very latest skills and qualities that they will need to succeed in the vibrant IT orientated world. You will develop specialist skills in security technologies and techniques and in particular the use of intrusion techniques and penetration testing as methods of determining the robustness of IT security.
One of the following:

ul.li: HND Computer Networks and Internet Technology, HND Computing: Technical Support or other related HND
Applicants with appropriate qualifications, or relevant industry experience will also be considered

div.p: Sport Scotland estimate that approximately 40,000 people are employed in the Scottish Sport and Leisure industry. The BSc Sport and Fitness will prepare learners for a broad range of career opportunities in a wide range of sport-related jobs. In recent years, graduates from similar programmes have found positions with, among others, the UK and regional Sports Councils, national governing bodies of sport, international organisations, professional clubs, local authorities, in the Leisure industry, sports clothing/footwear companies, the pharmaceutical industry and the Armed Forces. Furthermore, undergraduate study provides a preparation for Post-Graduate Certificate of Education (PGCE) courses and degrees at Masters level.

ul.li: HND Sports Coaching or related HND
Experience or other qualifications may be considered

div.p: BSc (Hons) Sport and Exercise at the University of Abertay Dundee

The BSc Construction degree programme offers aspiring professionals in the Construction industry the opportunity to study for a degree whist in full-time employment. This well-rounded programme includes all the key elements necessary to allow graduates to build a skills profile to access careers across the whole industry.

ul.li: Construction Studies: Technology Materials and Building Services
Building Maintenance, Adaptation Conversion and Demolition, Facilities Management
An HND in a Construction discipline is an essential entry requirement

div.p: If you are already working in an engineering industry, this programme will allow you to study for a degree whilst in full-time employment. This course is well-rounded and you will study elements in Mechanical, Mechatronic, Electronic and Production Engineering.
A wide range of career opportunities are available to students who are committed to continuing their professional development.

ul.li: Other qualifications equivalent to the above
Ideally applicants should be in full-time employment within the Engineering sector for the project

course.title: Certificate Advanced European Computer Driving Licence

div.p: There are 3 levels of qualifications available:
Foundation
Intermediate

ul.li: ECDL - Seven modules covering file storage and Internet, to the Microsoft Office Suite

div.p: Advanced
ECDL

ECDL is designed to cover the key concepts of computing, its practical applications and their use in the workplace and society. It is broken down into seven modules, each of which must be passed before an ECDL certificate is awarded. The seven modules that make up core ECDL are:

ul.li: Using the Computer and Managing Files

div.p: Benefits of Taking ECDL

ul.li: Raise your level of competency in IT and computing skills
Improves your productivity at home and work
Requires no prior knowledge of IT or computer skills
Provides you with a worldwide recognised qualification

div.p: Advanced ECDL
What is Advanced ECDL?

Due to the success of European Computer Driving Licence® (ECDL) the ECDL Foundation have developed a series of 4 Advanced modules which are designed to test your skills at a much higher level. The modules cover the main Microsoft Office Suite of software packages and can be studied individually to sharpen up your skills in particular areas. The 4 advanced modules are:
Word Processing (Microsoft ® Word)

You will learn how to use the advanced tools within Microsoft Word enabling you to produce word processing documents, illustrating a wide range of styles, fonts formats and layouts. This module also covers how to insert graphics, tables and even how to integrate databases to produce mail merge letters.
Spreadsheets (Microsoft Excel)

Learn how to use the advanced tools within Microsoft Excel enabling you to edit, manipulate and interpret numeric data, as well as formatting and sorting, querying data. Also learn how to use functions for statistical or mathematical operations which are useful when you are analysing the data contained in the spreadsheet.
Databases (Microsoft Access)
Using Microsoft Access you will create advanced queries, link forms, produce calculated reports, import and export data into a variety of formats and record macros.
Presentations (Microsoft PowerPoint)
On completion of this module you will know how to prepare a presentation appropriate to the target audience using advanced features such as multimedia, hyperlinks and graphics.
Who are the Modules for?

The Advanced modules are suitable for anyone who has already undertaken ECDL or those who wish to learn more about the advanced tools within the Microsoft Office Suite. The modules can be studied individually or you can choose to do more than one or the full set of four to enhance your IT skills.
Study Methods
All of the courses are offered on a flexible basis so that you can study at your own pace in the location of your choice. For example:

Flexible Learning with Your Own PC or Access to a College PC - You will be given a student workbook, which describes in detail how to carry out each task, you will then carry out a series of tasks. A tutor will be assigned to you at induction to offer support by email/telephone or in person.
Day/Evening Classes - Alternatively you may wish to consider attending our classes. We have classes running at a variety of times during the day and evening.

Customised Courses - Training courses can be devised to suit the needs of employers - the number of days would depend on your existing level of knowledge. Training can take place at College or in the workplace.

course.title: Certificate Foundation European Computer Driving Licence E-Type

div.p: What is E-type?
E-type is the quick and easy way to learn to touch type with ten fingers!
What Will I Learn?
You will be guided through 10 comprehensive and enjoyable lessons. E-type alternates between speed and practice and accuracy lessons to improve skills in both areas.
Do I Have to Sit an Exam?

Yes, once you have completed the course, you will then sit a five minute examination that tests your speed and accuracy. There is also an optional 5-minute warm up test. The tests are marked electronically, and the result is displayed on-screen immediately after you have completed the test.
There are 3 different grades for the e-type qualification:

ul.li: Introduction 20 words per minutes at 98% accuracy
Intermediate 40 words per minute at 98% accuracy
Advanced 60 words per minute at 98% accuracy

div.p: There are 3 tests available. This enables you to try for all 3 grades or have a chance to re-sit tests. If you pass a test at the Advanced grade on your first attempt, then there will be no need for you to sit more tests and therefore the two remaining test licences will be removed. If you achieve the Intermediate grade test first time then you will still have two chances left to pass Advanced. Likewise, if you achieve the Introductory grade first time then you will have two tests to attempt the Intermediate and the Advanced Grades. The British Computer Society will issue a pass certificate at each grade only once for each learner.

course.title: Certificate Foundation European Computer Driving Licence Equal Skills

div.p: What is Equal Skills?
Equal Skills is aimed at those who have no computer experience at all and is ideal for complete beginners.
What Will I Learn?
First of all you will learn about the basics of a computer such as the different parts of a computer, how to get started and how to use the keyboard and the mouse.
Do I Have to Sit an Exam?

No. When you enrol for the course you will be issued with a workbook, when you have completed each task successfully your tutor will sign off the tasks and send away your completed record to the British Computer Society. You will then be issued with a certificate.

course.title: Certificate Foundation European Computer Driving Licence e-Citizen

div.p: What is E-Citizen?
E-Citizen is a brand new qualification from the ECDL family. It is aimed at those who have some computer knowledge but are using the Internet on a very limited basis or not at all
What Will I Learn?

This programme is divided into 3 blocks: In block 1 you will learn about the computer hardware and software, how to use the desktop, scroll bars and dialog boxes, how to use files and folders, create, edit, save and print documents and learn the basic principles of the Internet and email.

In block 2 you will learn about computer viruses, virus protection, firewalls, parental control, data security and other potential risks. Then you will browse the internet for information in areas such as news, government, travel, employment and health. You will also learn how to use bookmarks, save and print web pages.

In block 3 you will use the skills that you have acquired throughout the course to carry out day-to-day tasks online such as paying bills, buying a CD, making a holiday reservation, completing a job application or taking part in a discussion group. You will also look at some of the risks associated with the Internet such as credit card fraud and take precautionary steps to avoid it.
What Materials Will I Use?
You will be given a student workbook, which describes in detail how to carry out each task, you will then carry out a series of tasks via email and the Internet.

The Cisco CCNP curriculum includes four modules, which align with the four exams required for CCNP certification. The CCNP curriculum builds on Cisco CCNA courses with more complex network configurations, diagnosis, and troubleshooting

The curriculum is intended for those interested in continuing their post-CCNA preparation to become network administrators, Level 2 support engineers, Level 2 systems engineers, network technicians, or deployment engineers.
Building Scalable Internetworks

In this course, students will learn how to create an efficient and expandable enterprise network. Students will also learn how to install, configure, monitor, and troubleshoot network infrastructure equipment. Topics include configuration of EIGRP, OSPF, IS-IS, and BGP routing protocols, and how to manipulate and optimise routing updates between these protocols. Other topics include multicast routing, IPv6, and DHCP configuration.
Implementing Secure Converged Wide-Area Networks

Students are introduced to secure enterprise class network services for teleworkers and branch sites. Students will learn how to secure and expand the reach of an enterprise network with a focus on VPN configuration and securing network access. Topics include teleworker configuration and access, frame-mode MPLS, site-to-site IPSEC VPN, Cisco EZVPN, strategies used to mitigate network attacks, Cisco device hardening, and IOS firewall features.
Building Multilayer Switched Networks

This course covers the deployment of state-of-the-art campus LANs. The primary focus is on the selection and implementation of the appropriate Cisco IOS services to build reliable, scalable, multilayer-switched LANs. Focus areas of the course include VLANs, Spanning Tree Protocol, wire-less client access, minimising service loss, and minimising data theft in a campus network. This hand-on, lab-orientated course stresses the design, implementation, operation, and troubleshooting of multilayer switched networks.
Optimising Converged Networks

Optimising Converged Networks introduces students to effective QoS techniques for optimisation in converged networks with voice, wireless, and security applications. Topics include implementing a VoIP network, specific mechanisms for implementing the DiffServ QoS model, AutoQoS, wireless security, and basic wireless management.
Further Cisco Certifications - www.cisco.com/go/certifications.

div.p: Theatre Production in the UK is currently undergoing an unprecedented period of growth with over 30,000 stage managers and theatre technicians needed for the Olympics and Commonwealth Games. Theatre, events and music industries and the new National Theatre of Scotland provides an ever-increasing choice and variety of career opportunities. The buoyant employment market needs well trained stage managers and technicians with a good grounding in all production disciplines. On this HNC students will be given an excellent training to prepare them for the profession or studies at degree level.
Practical Projects

Throughout the course you will be taught the theory and techniques within each production department, which will underpin all production work. You will undertake the roles of Stage Manager and Production Manager, Deputy Stage Manager, Lighting and Sound Designer and/or Set and Costume Designer on the in-house and touring productions and projects within the department. You will also gain experience in budgeting, funding and production administration.
Practical Projects

Throughout the course you will be taught the theory and techniques within each production department, which will underpin all production work. You will undertake the roles of Stage Manager and Production Manager, Deputy Stage Manager, Lighting and Sound Designer and/or Set and Costume Designer on the in-house and touring productions and projects within the department. You will also gain experience in budgeting, funding and production administration.

During the programme you may have the opportunity to have a guaranteed interview by the University of Dundee to study Adult Nursing, Child Health, Learning Disability and Midwifery. This stimulating and varied range of Health Care, and Core Skills subjects can lead you on to a variety of other careers or further study options. The programme also incorporates the new National Qualification in Health and Social care.
A range of Health and Care subjects including:
Work Experience

Practical experience within a care setting (one-week block placement and one-day per week placement for fifteen weeks) enables students to develop practical, interpersonal and decision-making skills. All students will be asked to give consent for a criminal record check to be carried out by Disclosure Scotland. No placement experience can be organised without a satisfactory report.
Employment in a variety of Health and Social Care settings.
One of the following:

ul.li: 4 Standard Grades at Grade 2 or above, English and numeracy preferred
Pre-access to Nursing/Introduction to Childcare/Introduction to Care
Applicants without formal qualifications will be expected to demonstrate the ability to work at Higher level

div.p: Note: This area of work involves helping vulnerable groups and successful applicants should be mature in attitude and well motivated. Good interpersonal and communication skills, excellent timekeeping and attendance along with medical fitness are essential.

All students will be asked to give consent for a criminal records check to be carried out by Disclosure Scotland. This programme will be the first stage in student training to become a teacher.

course.title: NQ Intermediate 2 to Higher Introduction to Games Technology

div.p: The UK games industry currently employs more than 20,000 people, and it is still growing. This market needs trained professionals to fill a recognised skills gap. This introductory programme will equip you with an overall knowledge of the essential elements in Games Design and will provide an ideal platform for you to progress onto an advanced level programme.

The Computer Game Design industry contributes significantly to the UK and global economy. New gaming technologies and the insatiable appetite for new games keeps the demand for experienced creative individuals high.
Possible careers include Games Level Designer, Environment Artist, 3D-Graphics Artist, Animator, Character Artist and Sound Designer.
3 Standard Grades including English and Maths at Grade 3 or above.

Applicants will be asked to present evidence within a design portfolio illustrating their creative ability. This can include finished design solutions, photography, illustration, animation, 3D Models, and sketchbooks.

ul.li: BA/BSc in Computer Games Design, Digital Media, etc

course.title: PDA Computer Aided Draughting and Design

div.p: Whether you are a novice or experienced CAD user, this course offers you the opportunity to earn a nationally recognised CADD qualification and to progress towards an advanced level of practical CADD skills. The content of the Professional Development Award is aimed at providing you with the opportunity to formalise a professional development qualification and/or to develop practical CADD skills relevant to this industry standard application. This course gives you the opportunity to fully understand 2D CAD and develop skills in 3D modelling. You can also select further subjects from 3 options. These subjects range from feature based modelling, architectural CAD and advanced 2D CAD. The course focuses on the basic building blocks of CADD applications, moving towards more sophisticated CADD skills as you progress. The PDA is a good entry point if you would like to pursue a career as a CADD Technician in a variety of industries.
6 Credits are required to achieve the PDA in CAD

div.p: This course is for everyone but especially suited if you are thinking about moving into work or study. Or if your kids are at school now and you'd like to do something that's just for you, Skills for Life could be what you're looking for.

Skills for Life covers a wide range of taster sessions including arts and crafts, computers and basic certificated courses including Food Hygiene and First Aid. What's more, it is also a great way to get back into studying if you haven't done anything for a while, even since school, or if you have always thought about coming back to college but never got round to it.
